Do you need the ACES 1.3 CTL for the SDR Rec.709 100‑nit ODT? If so:

- File name (ACES 1.x): ODT.Academy.Rec709_100nits_dim.ctl. TransformID: ODT.Academy.Rec709_100nits_dim.a1.0.3. It targets D65, 100 cd/m², dim surround, with BT.1886 EOTF (gamma 2.4), full-range output. ([community.acescentral.com](https://community.acescentral.com/uploads/default/original/1X/ee0e33645ccb873afd164deec2e5d37be2dd8c97.pdf?utm_source=openai))
- Where to get it: Use the ACES 1.3 tag of the ACES codebase (pre‑2.0 history) and navigate to transforms/ctl/odt/rec709/. In ACES setups you chain RRT.ctl then this ODT. Example usage: ctlrender -ctl RRT.ctl -ctl odt/rec709/ODT.Academy.Rec709_100nits_dim.ctl input.exr output.exr. ([github.com](https://github.com/aces-aswf/aces-core/tags))
- Variant: If you need the D60-simulated version for Rec.709, use ODT.Academy.Rec709_D60sim_100nits_dim.ctl (also BT.1886, 100 nits, dim). ([community.acescentral.com](https://community.acescentral.com/uploads/default/original/1X/ee0e33645ccb873afd164deec2e5d37be2dd8c97.pdf?utm_source=openai))

Tell me if you want the exact file path in the repo, the CTL header, or an OCIO view that matches this ODT. ([github.com](https://github.com/AcademySoftwareFoundation/OpenColorIO-Config-ACES?utm_source=openai))
